radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions and no evidence of lymphadenopathy.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT Scan of the Abdomen and Pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal hepatic parenchyma, moderate amount of ascites, mild splenomegaly, and no evidence of lymphadenopathy.
Homogeneous FDG uptake in the spleen, no evidence of hypermetabolism in the abdominal or pelvic lymph nodes.
Ill-defined areas of increased attenuation along the preseptal soft tissues and inferior orbital areas bilaterally, with no signs of a focal drainable collection.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) of the Face and Orbits
radiographic_examinations.findings: Signal hyperintensity within bilateral preseptal soft tissues, right lateral pterygoid and temporalis muscles, asymmetric mild enlargement and enhancement of the left superior oblique, medial, and lateral recti.
Large intraparenchymal hemorrhage in the left cerebellar hemisphere with mass effect on the brain stem and fourth ventricle.
